para.text: May encompass precincts from more than one county; but
Is limited to the contest and the precincts specified in the petition.
Required. The board shall first ascertain that the ballot used in the contest to be recounted was the correct ballot.
Methods.
For direct recording equipment, the determination shall be made by inspecting the ballot as it appeared on the face of the machine.
For paper ballots on which the ballot information is printed, the determination shall be made:
As the ballots are manually counted; or
By inspecting the ballots before machine tabulation.
Report of Incorrect Ballot. If the board finds that an incorrect ballot was used in one or more precincts, it shall immediately notify the State Board.
Method of Recount.
The procedure for recounting absentee and provisional ballots shall be the same as for recounting other ballots, as provided in this subtitle.
Absentee and provisional ballots shall be recounted in a way that assures voter confidentiality.
Reporting Recount. Absentee and provisional ballots shall be recounted and reported as separate tallies.

section.heading: Breaks.
section.text: To ensure accuracy, every effort should be made to schedule necessary interruptions of the recount, such as for lunch, for breaks, or to end the day, so that the interruptions do not fall in the middle of the count for a precinct.

para.text: In General. After the recount is complete, the local board shall correct, as appropriate:
The official returns; and
Any certificates that were issued on the basis of those returns.
Notice to State Board.
The local board shall immediately notify the State Board of all corrections made to official returns as a result of the recount.
The State Board shall then correct its official canvass records accordingly.
Voting Machines. Voting machines and direct recording equipment reviewed in the recount shall:
Be closed, secured, and, if necessary, resealed; and
Remain secured and sealed until the State Administrator releases them.
Ballots. Ballots shall be:
Assembled, packaged, sealed, and placed in appropriate secure storage; and
Retained as long as required by law.

Documents, Paraphernalia. All tally sheets, canvass sheets, memory devices, programs, printouts, and any other documents and paraphernalia associated with counting, documenting, or validating the election shall be:
Packaged and placed in appropriate secure storage; and
Retained as long as required by law.
